Description of incident: A law enforcement agency seized            a computer file with Kaiser data from a person who was subsequently            arrested. The suspect was not a Kaiser employee. Kaiser Permanente is            notifying nearly 30,000 Northern California employees that the security            breach may have led to the release of their personal information. The            stolen information included names, addresses, dates of birth and Social            Security numbers for Kaiser employees.UPDATE (9/28/2011): A former benefits clerk from Service Employees International Union-affiliated United Healthcare Workers West (SEIU-UHW) was sentenced to 12 years and four months in prison for stealing Kaiser union employee information.
